alert.note: Alert for Bergen (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 6:10AM EST until December 20 at 1:00AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...River and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues in the Hackensack River basin. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Jersey, including the following county, Bergen. * WHEN...Until 915 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. It will take until later today for the water to recede below flood stage for the Hackensack River at Milford and Rivervale. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 605 AM EST, gauge reports indicated heavy rain. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dumont, River Vale, Emerson, Old Tappan, Harrington Park and Haworth. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away from flood waters. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
